title: Simple burglar alarm
content: In this tutorial you will learn how to create a simple burglar alarm

Select **EnviromentalMotion** to detect motion with your device's camera

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/EnviromentalMotion-Item.png)
this will be used to measure the intensity of movement of potential thieves.

Scan the QR code with your smartphone.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/qrscan.png)

Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open the camera locally.

Move the **if** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/if-component.png), the **comparison** ![comparison](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/comparison-component.png), the **number** ![number](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/number-component.png) and the **intensity** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/simple-burglar-alarm/intensity.png) components to the workspace

Put the components of the previous step as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/simple-burglar-alarm/enviromental-motion.png)
the idea is that if the captured motion intensity is higher than the number you put, something happens.
